Type of CareCostLocationEducationSupport at Time of BirthLocation of Birth
GP Shared Care (shared between your local doctor and the hospital clinic)Hospital = free
GP = fee for serviceGP and HospitalHospital-based classes available for feeMidwife (doctors available in case of complication)Public hospital
Public hospital clinicFreeHospital outpatients or antenatal clinicHospital-based classes available for feeMidwife (doctors available in case of complication)Public hospital
Midwifery Group Practice / Caseload MidwiferyFreeBirth centre or private clinic on/off hospitalContinuous, one- on-one +
hospital-based classes available for feeMidwife (doctors available in case of complication)Public hospital/ birth centre affiliated with same
Private Midwife$3500-6000 out of pocket average (some Medicare rebates)Home, birth centre or private clinicContinuous, one- on-one, + hospital-based classes available for feeMidwife (if homebirth, transfer to hospital occurs in case of complication)Home, public hospital or birth centre affiliated with same
Private Obstetrician$4000+ average out of pocket (some Medicare/private health rebates)Private clinicMinimal education depending on OB + hospital-based classes available for feeMidwife until end of pushing stage, OB usually visits during labour 1-2 times depending on lengthPrivate hospital (unless major complication then possible transfer to public system)
